messages.message: I found something interesting! Here is a draft PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/28588/files) that I put out a week ago which only touches .js files. I reran it today and the jenkins pipeline (https://jenkins.instabase.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/instabase/detail/PR-28588/3/pipeline/) shows that it is picking up code changes for a million files that this PR didn't touch. (As a reference, the pipeline only ran one file (https://jenkins.instabase.com/blue/organizations/jenkins/instabase/detail/PR-28588/1/pipeline/) first time I triggered it) As a result it is testing almost all the packages. I did a rough look up and it looks like all of those files are all touched within the last week.

and then I actually found that this is expected behavior: https://github.com/hongrunz/instabase/blob/master/shared-utils/build-utils/shared/src/py/helpers/paths.py#L94. When we do git diff we compare to `remotes/origin/master`  so the script must have picked up all these diffs and run all these tests.
